Body:
Consider phrases such as these:

  • "Joe from France"
  • "Transport of wheat"
  • "Walking to Berlin

Are there specific grammatical terms for a) the constituent that occurs immediately before a preposition and b) the constituent that occurs immediately after a preposition?
Title: What are the terms for a) the constituent before a preposition and b) the constituent after a preposition?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe: I'm a conlanger who needs reliable information about real languages. By profession, I'm a speech/language therapist, so some of my questions may be work-related as well.
